This is a soft and comfortable hoodie that didn't shrink or fade when I washed and dried it. The graphics are well done and the colors are just as shown. There were no loose threads and the stitching is good. The inside is fleece and very cozy feeling, like being wrapped in a blanket. It's not too thick but isn't thin either. It's perfect to wear over a t-shirt during the autumn months, no jacket needed.  As far as sizing, I'm 5'2", weigh 110 lbs with a slight athletic build and have a bra size of 34 A/B. I got this in a small and it fits well. The sleeves go to about mid hand and stay put when I pull them up. The length of it sits right between my hips and upper thighs. It's loose fitting but not bulky or too boxy. I'm able to wear the hood comfortably as needed and when not, it sits comfortably around the neck/upper back area.  I admit I hadn't heard of Whistler, British Columbia before so I googled it. It's about 489 miles away from where I live. The photos are absolutely breathtaking and now I want to visit there even though I'm not one to ski or snowboard, which is what it's most known for. Obviously you can visit during the summer as hiking is something that attracts a lot of tourists, but the winter photos just scream "must see in person." I just might do that now.
